ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Interconnect_module_component is a type of . An Interconnect_module_component may be an . The Interconnect_module_component can be, for example, a circuit board in an assembly. Alternatively, it could be the substrate for a multi-chip module. This entity is included specifically so that the assembly design definition can be queried directly to determine which component in the assembly is the substrate. The Interconnect_module_component is likely the target of connectivity requirement information as allocated to various components. An Interconnect_module_component does not include all the internal details of the design of the .

An Interconnect_component_join_terminal is a type of that is some aspect of a generic participating in connectivity for a . This Interconnect_component_join_terminal is defined in-situ. An example of an Interconnect_component_join_terminal is a mechanical conductive fastener that attaches a flexible wire lead lug to the pcb. Current flows through the fastener because it is part of the conduction path for a signal. A plain wire is considered to be a mechanical component as well. There is no with it. This is the opposite end of the wire from that defined for the same wire in
the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_component_join_terminal.

the connection specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_component_join_terminal. The connection is optional and need not be supplied if the source system does not contain the data. If the source system contains the data, then the data shall be provided.

An Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is a type of that is some aspect of a generic participate in a connection for a . The Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is defined in-situ. There is no associated with it. An example of an Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is a mechanical conductive fastener that attaches a flexible wire lead lug to the pcb. Current flows through the fastener because it is part of the conduction path for a signal. A plain wire is considered to be an interconnect component as well. This Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is defined in-situ. There is no with it. This is the opposite end of the wire from that defined for the same wire in

the connection specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_component_interface_terminal. The connection is optional and need not be supplied if the source system does not contain the data. If the source system contains the data, then the data shall be provided.

An Interconnect_module_component_terminal is a type of . An Interconnect_module_component_terminal may be an or an . A member of Interconnect_module_component_terminal may be referenced by a member of Assembly_joint to describe the partial or complete implementation of a connection defined as a requirement by a member of Physical_connectivity_definition. Figure illustrates the relationship between an Interconnect_module_component_terminal and its mating feature in an assembly.
the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_component_terminal.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_component_terminal.

An Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature is a type of . An Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature is a surface or a segment of the edge of the identified for assembly purposes. The definition attribute inherited from shall specify a type of . The associated_component attribute inherited from Component_feature shall specify a member of . An Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature may also be an , but shall not be any other type of Component_feature. The entire primary or secondary surface of the may be considered to be a feature in this usage.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature.
